item.title: Get a look at Frostpunk 2’s console gameplay in a new trailer
item.content:encoded:
11 bit Studios has released a brand new trailer for the console version of Frostpunk 2, which shows how the development team has adapted the game for controller use. The console version of Frostpunk 2 will make use of radial menus for a lot of aspects of the game, including construction of the city, decision making, and exploration. The user interface has been designed so console players can easily navigate the menus and options that make up the gameplay of Frostpunk 2, and you can see it in action below.

Frostpunk 2 is set 30 years after the events of the original Frostpunk, taking players into the age of oil and all of the issues that come with that, both technological as your society moves on from coal and social strife that will divide the inhabitants.

We didn’t review Frostpunk 2 for its PC release, though will look to catch up on the Polish Game of the Year game when it hits consoles, but looking back at that original game, Jason wrote in our Frostpunk review, “Frostpunk is a horrifyingly playable post-apocalyptic survival game that demands more out of you than most games ever could. Each decision and each sacrifice you make is hard on your city and on you. There are so many impossible choices and no win situations that the game is almost hard to play, but it’s so compelling that you will be unable to step away from it. The only real negative is the sheer overwhelming nature of the world the game is set in, and really that is more of a compliment to the designers than anything else.”

Frostpunk 2 will launch for PS5 and Xbox Series X|S on 18th September,

Source: Press Release

item.title: PlayStation 5 console prices to rise in the US
item.content:encoded:
Sony has announced that it will be raising the prices of the PlayStation 5 consoles in the US. While Sony does not give the reasons why, it is likely to do with the the tariffs that the US Government has brought in over the past several months, which has caused prices to rise across various goods for consumers in the country. The full statement from Sony is as follows.

Similar to many global businesses, we continue to navigate a challenging economic environment. As a result, we’ve made the difficult decision to increase the recommended retail price for PlayStation 5 consoles in the U.S. starting on August 21.

The updated recommended retail price for PlayStation 5 consoles in the U.S. are as follows:

  • PlayStation 5 – $549.99
  • PlayStation 5 Digital Edition – $499.99
  • PlayStation 5 Pro – $749.99

The recommended retail prices for PlayStation 5 accessories remain unchanged, and we have no other price changes to announce for additional markets.

As stated the price rises come in tomorrow, August 21st so if you are in the US and were waiting to get a PS5 now is probably the best time to get your order in.

Source: PS Blog

item.title: Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles gameplay trailer released
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix has released a new Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles gameplay trailer that gives a look at what to expect in this new release of the game. The trailer shows various clips from what appears to be the enhanced version of Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles, to showcase the differences with the original version, which is also included in the package.

This Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles trailer includes the new user interface that players will see in the enhanced edition, where it will be easier to see turn order and issue commands. There is a birds eye tactical view added so you can better plan your strategy in battles. A battle speed option is also present in the enhanced version so you can speed through battles instead of waiting for every animation to play out at normal speed. The trailer also shows the enhanced visuals over the original so the art looks on modern displays. The game will feature new voice acting and new conversations that have been written by Yasumi Matsuno.

Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles is available for pre-order, with two versions including a standard edition and a deluxe edition. The Deluxe edition, which costs £54.99 includes:

  • FINAL FANTASY TACTICS – The Ivalice Chronicles full game
  • Weapon: Akademy Blade (Raises a unit’s speed attribute slightly while equipped)
  • Headwear: Akademy Beret (Prevents the Charmed status while equipped)
  • Combat Garb: Akademy Tunic (Grants Shell while equipped)
  • Accessory: Ring of Aptitude (Boosts JP earned while equipped)
  • Consumable Items: Phoenix Down x10
  • Black Equipment for Ramza
  • Red Equipment for Ramza

Final Fantasy Tactics: The Ivalice Chronicles will be released on September 30th for PC, PS5, PS4, Xbox Series XS, Switch, and Switch 2.

Source: Square Enix
